title: Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name should also be used as the name of the URI parameter when the session id is encoded in the URL, provided that URL rewriting is enabled. However, the observed behavior is that even though a custom cookie name (MYSESSIONCOOKIE) is set, the page sends a cookie with a different name (JSESSIONID).
EB: The expected behavior is that when a custom name is configured for session tracking cookies in a web application and URL rewriting is enabled, the same custom name should be used as the name of the URI parameter in the URL.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Set a custom name for the session tracking cookies in a web application.
2. Ensure that URL rewriting is enabled.
3. Load the web application and access a page.
4. Observe the name of the sent cookie and the URL used for reloading the page.
